meanings.sent1: In Uzbekistan, you can buy many things with just one som.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for som when I visited Uzbekistan.
meanings.sent3: The som in Uzbekistan sure knows how to make people happy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny som, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The som jingled in his pocket, a sound of wealth and possibility.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight in India, equal to about 1.3 pounds
meanings.sent1: She carried a heavy load of som on her head in India.
meanings.sent2: The market vendor measured the spices in som for the customer.
meanings.sent3: The som weighed on her mind as she tried to lift it.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was as heavy as a sack of som.
meanings.sent5: The som pressed down on the scale, a measure of strength and endurance.

meanings.definition: A group or collection of items or things
meanings.sent1: The som of books on the shelf was impressive.
meanings.sent2: She organized the som of toys neatly in the playroom.
meanings.sent3: The som of socks seemed to have a mind of its own, always disappearing.
meanings.sent4: The som of stars in the sky twinkled brightly that night.
meanings.sent5: The som of memories flooded back, overwhelming her with nostalgia.
